alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin, Worland BLM; South Big Horn Basin, Worland BLM (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 06 at 12:16PM MDT until September 08 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * IMPACTS: Low Humidities...Hot Temperatures...Strong Gusty Winds and a Wind Shift with a Cold Front will create erratic fire behavior and new fire starts. * AFFECTED AREA: In North Central WY...Fire Weather Zones 275...276 and 282. * COUNTIES AFFECTED: In North Central WY...Big Horn...Hot Springs...Park...Washakie. * COLD FRONT: A cold front will sweep across the Big Horn Basin during the day Thursday, bringing an abrupt wind shift from the northwest. * WIND: West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. North winds 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph behind the front. * THUNDERSTORMS: Thunderstorm activity is expected along and behind the front on Thursday and Thursday evening. * HUMIDITY: As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES: Highs in the lower 80s.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin, Worland BLM; South Big Horn Basin, Worland BLM
